title: [Large-Scale] Design Thinking-Based Project Learning in Science Fields

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific research methodologies and data analysis experience
context.additional_context: A practical competency-building course for office/administrative professionals in science-based problem-solving. Focuses on creating real-world impact through community-linked projects.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze science domain problems and derive solutions by applying design thinking methodologies

Over 4 weeks, learners collaborate in multidisciplinary teams (3–5 members: engineering, social sciences, design, etc.) following the PBL process (problem definition → idea generation → solution development → evaluation) to create actionable project proposals for solving community issues (e.g., optimizing waste segregation). They incorporate ≥3 rounds of field expert feedback and submit final reports.

During a 2–4-week midterm course, learners establish 3 measurable social impact metrics (e.g., community participation rate, energy savings, number of program beneficiaries) for science project outcomes, collecting quantitative data (surveys, monitoring records) to evaluate them with ≥80% reliability.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
